articles.author: Ethan Gach
articles.description:
Nintendo announced Fire Emblem Engage earlier today and reactions to its new hero with the Icee-colored hair are rolling in. Some are fine with it. Others hate it. What’s indisputable is that it looks like the design for a modern-day VTuber. Like and subscribe please. Uwu.
Read more...
articles.title: New Fire Emblem Hero Looks Like A VTuber, And There’s A Reason

articles.author: Ethan Gach
articles.description:
Octopath Traveler. Triangle Strategy. Forspoken. These are just a few of Square Enix’s weirder game titles. But today, the Final Fantasy publisher reminded the world of one of its all-time-greats: Various Daylife. The iOS JRPG now has a Switch port. It came out today and it’s still called, well, that. I’m not sure …
Read more...
articles.title: Let’s Remember Some Terrible Square Enix Video Game Names

articles.author: Levi Winslow
articles.description:
With Splatoon 3 finally out on Nintendo Switch, folks have no doubt tried their hands at a variety of the game’s eclectic weapons. There are plenty to check out, from the classic rapid-firing Splattershot Jr. to newer weapons like the quick-slashing Splatana (which has quickly become a fave of mine). However, while…
Read more...
articles.title: Splatoon 3's Most-Hated Gun Needs To Go, Players Say

articles.author: Isaiah Colbert
articles.description:
The tag “Netflix original anime series” has had its fair share of ups and downs over the years, sometimes being affixed to bold, exhilarating new shows, at other times to deflating disappointments. However, Studio Trigger and CD Projekt Red’s Cyberpunk: Edgerunners tips the scales in a significant way toward proving…
Read more...
articles.title: Netflix’s Cyberpunk: Edgerunners Tells The Story I Wished For In Cyberpunk 2077

articles.author: Claire Jackson
articles.description:
Today’s Nintendo Direct showed off tons of visual splendor and many games to get excited about, and even included the long-awaited reveal of the official title for the next Zelda game. The celebration wasn’t had everywhere, however, as Nintendo UK, per its announcement yesterday on Twitter, chose not to livestream the…
Read more...
articles.title: The Legend of Zelda: Tears Of The Kingdom Has Fans Convinced The Name Impacted The Nintendo Direct

articles.author: Patricia Hernandez
articles.description:
Tuesday’s Nintendo Direct was a much-hyped affair, with a whopping 40 minutes dedicated to the Japanese company’s portable console and its games. Most people kept their expectations somewhat in check for this, because Nintendo said that the event would largely focus on products coming out this holiday season. But that…
Read more...
articles.title: Shigeru Miyamoto Accidentally Trolled Everyone During The Big Nintendo Direct

articles.author: Ethan Gach
articles.description:
Rumors of a GoldenEye 007 remaster have been making the rounds for a while now. Today, it was finally revealed in the weirdest way possible. While Nintendo promoted a port with online play for its Switch Online Expansion Pack during a big September Direct, Microsoft quietly revealed a better version of the game would…
Read more...
articles.title: Microsoft Announces Arguably Better GoldenEye For Xbox Right When Nintendo Does

articles.author: Patricia Hernandez
articles.description:
It’s been a long while since we’ve heard anything about the next Zelda game, hasn’t it? Fortunately, today’s Nintendo Direct finally gave us another glimpse of the highly anticipated action adventure game by Nintendo, to hold us steady until its release next year. It’s coming on 5/13/2023, and it’s called The Legend…
Read more...
articles.title: The Legend of Zelda: Breath Of The Wild 2 Gets A Totally Different Name, Release Date, And Trailer

articles.author: Claire Jackson
articles.description:
At this morning’s Nintendo Direct, we got a look at the next wave of maps headed for Mario Kart 8 as part of the Booster Course Pack originally announced back in February. With the last set of new and classic courses hitting the game back in August, fans of the colorful, shenanigan-filled kart racer have likely been…
Read more...
articles.title: New Tracks Are Hitting Next Mario Kart 8 Switch This Holiday

articles.author: Ethan Gach
articles.description:
Everyone’s favorite 1997 multiplayer shooter is finally coming to Switch Online alongside a stack of other Nintendo 64 games including Mario Party and Pokémon Stadium. Better yet, GoldenEye 007 64 will launch with online play.
Read more...
articles.title: GoldenEye And Other Great Classics Heading To Nintendo Switch Online

articles.author: John Walker
articles.description:
In a surprise announcement, Nintendo revealed during this morning’s Direct that there’s a sequel to Octopath Traveler on the way, and it’s due out in only five months.

Read more...
articles.title: Octopath Traveler Gets Switch Sequel, Out In February

articles.author: Ethan Gach
articles.description:
Fire Emblem Engage is the next game in Nintendo’s hit tactical RPG series, the company announced today. It’s coming to Switch on January 20, 2023, and features the return of fan-favorite fighter Marth alongside a new red-and-blue-haired hero.

Read more...
articles.title: A New Fire Emblem Is Coming To Switch, And Marth's Back

articles.author: Claire Jackson
articles.description:
Gloomwood, a first-person stealth game with a killer retro style that just hit Steam Early Access, is garnering its share of praise. Being in pre-release, it’s not quite finished yet, and does have some limitations. But if you want to get a peek at what looks to be a great tribute to classic Thief, with some Bloodborne…
Read more...
articles.title: Stealth Games Like This New Sneak 'Em Up Are A Rare Breed

articles.author: Ethan Gach
articles.description:
Today, publisher Square Enix and developer Platinum Games finally did what everyone had been predicting from the start: they announced Babylon’s Fall will shut down within its first year. While I’m hardly surprised, it still sucks. People paid $60 for this game just six months ago, and less than six months from now it…
Read more...
articles.title: Square Enix Shutting Down PS5's Worst Game Before It's Even A Year Old

articles.author: Luke Plunkett
articles.description:
If you’ve been watching The Lord of the Rings: Rings Of Power, you’ll have sat through a few episodes by now, and will have seen the show’s surprisingly sedated intro sequence. If like me you’ve been wondering just what exactly is the deal with all those shapes, and all that bouncing sand, it turns out there’s a very…
Read more...
articles.title: There's A Cool Story Behind Rings Of Power's Intro

articles.author: Luke Plunkett
articles.description:
Hideo Kojima’s new podcast isn’t for everyone, so thankfully it’s not the only place we can turn to for development stories from the games he’s worked on. Like this one about a very tedious idea for Metal Gear Solid 3.

Read more...
articles.title: Metal Gear Solid 3 Could Have Had A Boss Battle That Would Take Two Weeks To Finish

articles.author: Levi Winslow
articles.description:
Xbox owners who are part of the company’s Insiders program may have noticed something different about their consoles this week. Rolling out as a test of potential UI changes coming to the console next year, Xbox Insiders will see a new home screen that overhauls the user experience. Now, with videos of the potential…
Read more...
articles.title: Xbox’s New Test Dashboard Is Heavy On The Game Pass

articles.author: Zack Zwiezen
articles.description:
Over the weekend, Ubisoft announced about 50 different Assassin’s Creed games and projects. (Editor’s note: It was a lot…but not 50). The company also laid out the future of the series and how its upcoming hub, Infinity, will bring the franchise together in a way that we haven’t seen before. It also explained that…
Read more...
articles.title: Future Assassin's Creed Games Are Ditching Modern Day Stuff, And That's Disappointing

articles.author: Ashley Bardhan
articles.description:
Look, I can’t break new ground on “the gamer chair.” They are familiar: hulking, pricey, and often garish declarations of Fortnite prowess, padded with locks of Ninja’s blue hair (may we remember it fondly) for good luck. To accept the gamer chair is to accept the implication of Dorito dust. To know the gamer chair is…
Read more...
articles.title: Secretlab’s Fortnite Battle Bus Chair Is Comfy, If A Little Big

articles.author: Sisi Jiang
articles.description:
Ubisoft didn’t give us a ton to chew on when it unveiled Assassin’s Creed Red, which will follow next year’s Mirage in the long-running historical fiction series, beyond the fact that it’s set in Japan. However, that hasn’t stopped AC fans from making comparisons to Ghost of Tsushima, Sucker Punch’s 2020 open-world…
Read more...
articles.title: Here’s Hoping Assassin’s Creed Red Learns From What Ghost Of Tsushima Did Wrong

articles.author: Isaiah Colbert
articles.description:
One Piece fans are always dying to tell you, a person who’s yet to read creator Eiichiro Oda’s 25-year-old seafaring epic, that the manga is a work of art. Now that sentiment has become reality in the most ridiculous way possible: An artist has compiled all the 21,450 pages of One Piece that currently exist into a…
Read more...
articles.title: One Piece Gets Every Volume Merged Into One Long, 21,450 Page...Piece

articles.author: Ethan Gach
articles.description:
In the real world, everything runs on Dunkin. In Diablo Immortal, it’s powered by orbs. Eternal Orbs, to be precise. And players are once again reckoning with the mobile action-RPG’s microtransaction economy after Blizzard announced that players who’d purchased hundreds of thousands of illicit orbs from third-party…
Read more...
articles.title: Diablo Immortal Community Faces New Unrest Over Ill-Gotten Orbs, Lack Of Bans

articles.author: Ethan Gach
articles.description:
For as long as 343 Industries has existed, Bonnie Ross has been in charge of it. No longer. The Microsoft veteran announced on Monday that she would leave the studio in charge of Halo Infinite to deal with a family medical issue. It’s the latest high-profile departure on a pivotal Xbox game that continues to face big…
Read more...
articles.title: Head Of Halo Infinite Studio Is The Latest To Leave

articles.author: Patricia Hernandez
articles.description:
Disney’s big fan expo last weekend had an entire gaming block in which the entertainment company revealed the first trailer for a new Marvel game. But that was just the first glimpse. Later on, D23 also held a chat between Skydance developers Amy Hennig and Marc Bernardin, who, while vague about the particulars of…
Read more...
articles.title: Marvel's Captain America X Black Panther Game: 4 New Things We Just Learned

articles.author: Zack Zwiezen
articles.description:
Disney Dreamlight Valley–out now on Xbox, PlayStation, Switch and PC– is a new cozy life sim that combines the chill village vibes of Animal Crossing with the farming and mining of Stardew Valley, all while sprinkling on a heaping of Disney magic in the form of iconic characters and locations from popular films like …
Read more...
articles.title: 35 Things I Wish I Knew Before Playing Disney Dreamlight Valley

articles.author: John Walker
articles.description:
It’s always worth rooting around down the side of the bed, or in the drawers, when you stay in a hotel room. Who knows what exciting items may have been forgotten by the previous guest? Like, for instance, a top-secret Oculus VR headset. That’s what happened to hotel worker Ramiro Cardenas, who claims to have…
Read more...
articles.title: Meta's Hyped VR Headset May Have Been Leaked By Guy In A Hotel [Updated]

articles.author: John Walker
articles.description:
There’s going to be a Nintendo Direct on Tuesday morning, September 13th, at 10 a.m. ET, Nintendo has just announced. It’s going to be a big one, too, with an estimated clock time of 40 minutes. We’re hoping we’ll get to hear about some of the bigger games Nintendo has been silent on for a while, especially with the…
Read more...
articles.title: Next Big Nintendo Direct Won't Be Broadcast Everywhere To Mourn The Queen

articles.author: Ethan Gach
articles.description:
Splatoon 3 hasn’t just climbed to the top of the charts, it’s absolutely demolishing them, at least in Japan. Nintendo announced the latest sequel in its party shooter series has already sold over 3 million copies in just three days there, making Splatoon 3's launch bigger than The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild, …
Read more...
articles.title: Everyone Cares About Splatoon 3 More Than You Think

articles.author: Luke Plunkett
articles.description:
On September 10, 2002, publishers Electronic Arts and a relatively unknown developer called DICE released a multiplayer shooter called Battlefield 1942. In the 20 years since, everyone involved has been on one hell of a ride.
Read more...
articles.title: The Battlefield Series Is Now 20 Years Old

articles.author: Luke Plunkett
articles.description:
Disney had a big event last week that, I’ll be honest, I let wash over me. Announcements like Avatar games and Alien games that aren’t an Isolation sequel aren’t really for me. One thing they didn’t really cover, though, and which I wish they had done in a lot more detail, was the excellent news that classic…
Read more...
articles.title: 1995 Gargoyles Game Is Getting A Remaster

articles.author: Claire Jackson
articles.description:
Today Ubisoft showed off a wide variety of upcoming and currently available titles from the French publisher. With Ubisoft Forward, there were some fun titles like Mario + Rabbids and Just Dance, a bunch of stuff for The Division franchise, some hints at a partnership with Netflix, and a lot of Assassin’s Creed. Did I…
Read more...
articles.title: Everything We Saw At Ubisoft's Big Event Today

articles.author: Patricia Hernandez
articles.description:
I am sorry if the front page of Kotaku reads like an advertisement for Ubisoft right now, but do you want to know the wildest thing about it all? That’s not even everything that the French company announced recently in the world of Assassin’s Creed during its big Ubisoft Forward event. There was so much Assassin’s…
Read more...
articles.title: There's So Much Assassin's Creed Happening Now That It's Almost Hard To Keep Up

articles.author: Ethan Gach
articles.description:
It felt like Assassin’s Creed Valhalla might never end. Long after the seas had swallowed the continents and the stars had gone out, Eivor would still be finding new settlements to pillage and new cosmetics to play around with. But today Ubisoft announced the almost unthinkable: Valhalla has an end and it will be…
Read more...
articles.title: Assassin's Creed Valhalla Is Actually Ending, And The DLC Will Be Free

articles.author: Levi Winslow
articles.description:
Assassin’s Creed is getting a whole lot bigger with Infinity, a new live-service project Ubisoft announced today during its Forward presentation. Infinity aims to connect several different games together while introducing ongoing content updates that will roll out even more settings and timelines over its lifetime.
Read more...
articles.title: Assassin's Creed Infinity Announced, A Hub That Will Somehow Connect Games Together

articles.author: Ethan Gach
articles.description:
It’s finally happening: Assassin’s Creed is going to Japan. After a series of earlier reports and leaks, Ubisoft finally made the news official during Saturday’s 2022 gaming showcase.

Read more...
articles.title: After Years Of Anticipation, Assassin's Creed Is Finally Going To Japan

articles.author: Patricia Hernandez
articles.description:
Netflix seems determined to make its name in the gaming space. During Saturday’s Ubisoft Forward showcase, where the French company is highlighting its latest and greatest, the streaming giant came onstage to announce a new partnership that will see the release of three exclusive mobile games. Beyond a new Assassin’s…
Read more...
articles.title: Netflix Is Teaming Up With Ubisoft For Three Exclusive Games, Including A New Assassin's Creed

articles.author: Levi Winslow
articles.description:
During today’s Ubisoft Forward livestream, the company finally peeled back some of the layers to Assassin’s Creed Mirage, the “back-to-basics” stealth-action game that leaked late last month before getting confirmed as real.

Read more...
articles.title: Assassin’s Creed Is Back After Two Years Away, See It In Action In First Trailer

articles.author: Ethan Gach
articles.description:
Mario + Rabbids Sparks of Hope finally gets the deep dive fans have been waiting for ahead of its October 20 launch. The turn-based strategy formula is back, but with a bevy of new sci-fi tricks up its sleeves, and it’s giving me major Super Mario Galaxy 3-vibes. Also Rayman will be coming in one of the future DLCs. 

Read more...
articles.title: Mario + Rabbids Sparks of Hope Is Looking Like The Switch's Next Big Sleeper Hit

articles.author: Isaiah Colbert
articles.description:
Although it might’ve felt like Kinda Funny’s Blessing Adeoye Jr. was talking at 1.75x speed about upcoming games and world premieres, Disney and Marvel’s D23 stream event did manage to show a few games that weren’t just cinematic trailers. Here’s everything we saw at Disney and Marvel’s D23 Expo Showcase, organized in…
Read more...
articles.title: Everything Shown At Disney And Marvel's D23 Event

articles.author: Zack Zwiezen
articles.description:
Revealed today during the somewhat underwhelming Disney and Marvel Games Showcase, Illusion Island is a new 2D, animated platformer being developed by DLaLa Studios and which seems to be heavily inspired by the recent (and fantastic) animated Mickey Mouse cartoon shorts. And weirdly, this new platformer will be…
Read more...
articles.title: Lowkey, This Nintendo Switch Mickey Mouse Game Was The Coolest Thing At Disney’s Showcase

articles.author: Patricia Hernandez
articles.description:
Gameloft’s Disney-themed take on Animal Crossing hasn’t been in early access for very long, but the life simulator seems poised to take over the world already. It helps that there’s plenty more Disney Dreamlight Valley content coming down the pike, per today’s announcement at the big D23 Expo.
Read more...
articles.title: Disney Dreamlight Valley Is Expanding Fast, Toy Story Hits Soon

articles.author: John Walker
articles.description:
Ari Notis, Kotaku’s primary source for guides, puns, and woefully uncritical games coverage, is leaving us. That absolute bastard.

Read more...
articles.title: Let Us Notis That Ari Is Leaving

articles.author: Zack Zwiezen
articles.description:
The recently released multiplatform life-sim, Dreamlight Valley, is a bit Animal Crossing, a bit Stardew Valley, and a whole lot of Disney. It’s also the kind of game you might want to play while watching a TV show, multitasking with a handheld console. But while it did come out on Switch, that version isn’t great.…
Read more...
articles.title: Steam Deck May Be The Best Way To Play Disney Dreamlight Valley (With Some Tweaks)

articles.author: John Walker and Ethan Gach
articles.description:
Today’s Disney & Marvel Games Showcase officially revealed Amy Hennig’s latest unnamed game: a war thriller staring Black Panther and Captain America.

Read more...
articles.title: Classy New Marvel Game Stars Captain America And Black Panther In World War 2

articles.author: Zack Zwiezen
articles.description:
Lego Star Wars: The Skywalker Saga contained a mind-bogglingly epic amount of content and characters from all of the nine, main Star Wars films. Yet, there’s always more Star Wars out there. So, TT Games is adding even more characters to the game via DLC announced at D23 today.

Read more...
articles.title: Lego Star Wars: The Skywalker Saga Is About To Get A Bunch Of New Characters, Like Cassian Andor

articles.author: Ari Notis
articles.description:
Marvel’s Midnight Suns, which you may know as SpandeXCOM, got a release date again (again). Publisher 2K Games announced the news today with a splashy animated promo during the Disney and Marvel Games Showcase. It’s out December 2 for PS5, Xbox Series X/S, and PC.

Read more...
articles.title: Marvel’s Take On XCOM Gets Release Date Again, Plus Some Nice Animated Promos

articles.author: Ashley Bardhan
articles.description:
Anyone who has spoken to me in the last week knows that I am slowly losing my grip on reality due to the presence of rats in my apartment. The only thing keeping me from confronting the greasy creatures with a tactical vest made of rat coronavirus spike proteins and knives is Ooblets, the saccharine farming sim that…
Read more...
articles.title: 11 Things I Wish I Knew Before Starting The Full Version Of Ooblets

articles.author: Isaiah Colbert
articles.description:
It’s rare for a fighting game to extend an olive branch allowing both casual and hardcore players to have their fun, but JoJo’s Bizarre Adventure: All Star Battle R does a remarkable job while evincing the massively popular anime series’ undeniable charisma.
Read more...
articles.title: The New JoJo’s Bizarre Adventure Fighter Is A Perfect Celebration Of The Manga And Anime

articles.author: John Walker
articles.description:
Today is the official launch of the Pokémon Trading Card Game’s Lost Origin expansion, which might be the penultimate set for the Sword and Shield (SWSH) era before next year sees new packs based on Scarlet and Violet. And it marks the return of the Lost Zone, the very occasional mechanic that entirely changes how…
Read more...
articles.title: The Pokémon Card Game's New Expansion Dramatically Changes Everything

articles.author: Levi Winslow
articles.description:
Well, Blizzard’s surprise has been spoiled. Late last night, a YouTuber named Kuriboh cervantes uploaded a video revealing Overwatch 2's newest hero, Kiriko. The company tried cracking down on the content, an unfinished animated short that gives a bit of backstory to who Kiriko is and shows off some of her abilities,…
Read more...
articles.title: New Overwatch 2 Hero Leaks: A Teleporting Fox Girl Who Plays Support

articles.author: Patricia Hernandez
articles.description:
The passing of Britain’s long-reigning monarch has made the internet a curious place over the last 24 hours, as every brand on earth Says Something, and the rest of the world goes between mourning an important historical figure, metaphorically spitting on a colonialist grave, or shitposting themselves a path straight…
Read more...
articles.title: The Splatoon 3 Plaza Is Filling Up With Queen Elizabeth Posts Because Of Course It Is

articles.description:
Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom! Fire Emblem Engage! Pikmin 4!
Well, that was one heck of a Nintendo Direct, wasn't it? While it perhaps wasn't the massive Zelda blowout we were all expecting, Nintendo had no shortage of first-party reveals and exclusives, amidst some big Indies and multiplatform releases.
Let's start with the biggie, then — Breath of the Wild 2 sheds its number for a brand-new name: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom. That box art? *chef's kiss* We got a few short snippets of gameplay from next year's release, alongside an actual release date — 12th May 2023. it looks incredible, and it's going to be well worth the wait.
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Talking Point: What Did You Think Of The September 2022 Nintendo Direct?

articles.description:
Pew pew!
Today's Nintendo Direct Showcase was full of release dates that either felt very close or very far away. None more so was this the case with news that the classic arcade shoot 'em up Radiant Silvergun, from acclaimed Japanese developer Treasure, would be coming to Switch. What's more, it's landing on the console today!
A classic in its genre, Radiant Silvergun will provide you with five different weapons to take down a constant onslaught of enemies in ships of varyingly ridiculous sizes. The game comes in a retro pixelated look, wearing its arcade and Sega Saturn heritage on its sleeve.
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Out Now: Treasure's Classic Arcade Shmup 'Radiant Silvergun' Surprise Drops On Switch

articles.description:
Everybody was Kung Fu fighting.
Get working on your martial arts moves, as the Kung Fu action brawler Sifu is coming to Nintendo Switch on November 8th.
The Direct Showcase revealed a small trailer of the game (above), demonstrating the appealing hand-to-hand combat in all its crunchy action. Sifu will see you taking on hoards of opponents as you attempt to avenge your father, and looking at the trailer, it seems that this Switch port will not lose too much of the kinetic energy that the game holds on PlayStation. Which would be lovely, as our friends over at Push Square awarded it 8/10 and called it "brutal but brilliant".
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Sifu Punches Its Way To Switch In November

articles.description:
New series also in development.
Xseed Games has announced that Rune Factory 3 Special will be launching on Switch in 2023, remastering the game for a new generation.
It also revealed that a new Rune Factory series is now in development, though no further information was provided for this.
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Rune Factory 3 Special Heading To Switch In 2023

articles.description:
Out this October.
PlatinumGames' Bayonetta 3 stomped its way into today's Nintendo Direct, but our favourite witch had more to deliver afterwards with a solid look at the upcoming game's combat and gameplay.
Releasing on 28th October, we can see Bayonetta in action as she kicks and flips her way through demons in the upcoming third entry. You'll need to use plenty of Witch Time to get around some of these big creatures as you make your way through the city — and across the globe, too!
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Bayonetta 3 Bewitches With Demonic New Gameplay Trailer

articles.description:
Wii classic gets a new lease of life.
KOEI TECMO AMERICA has announced that Fatal Frame: Mask of the Lunar Eclipse will be making its way to the Switch in Early 2023, bringing the classic Wii title back to life with bumped-up visuals and an all-new photo mode.
Here's some official info from Koei Tecmo:
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Fatal Frame: Mask Of The Lunar Eclipse Haunts Switch Next Year

articles.description:
He's got a foot like a traction engine.
One of the pieces of update news to come out of the Nintendo Direct Showcase was the reveal of the new content coming to Mario Strikers: Battle League.
The big take aways from this announcement was the arrival of two new players: Pauline and Diddy Kong. Making a name for herself following Super Mario Odyssey, Pauline is set to be a useful asset on your team, with Nintendo summarising her play style as the following: 'a physical powerhouse with fast movements and strong tackles.'
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Mario Strikers: Battle League Scores Second Free Update, Coming This Month

articles.description:
Embark on the Journey of Regeneration again.
If you had a GameCube and you loved RPGs, then you've likely played Tales of Symphonia. The first Tales of game to be released in Europe, it's arguably among the best games on the system. Now, fans who may have got into the esteemed Tales of series late will be able to try out this classic when it gets a remaster on Switch next year!
During the Nintendo Direct, Bandai Namco's action RPG got its own dedicate section, showing off the game's combat, characters, and unique cell-shaded visuals that would go on to inspire the 3D entries going forward.
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Classic GameCube Action RPG 'Tales Of Symphonia' Getting Switch Remaster

articles.description:
Howdy there, partner.
Hazellight Studios' Game of the Year winner at the 2021 Game Awards, It Takes Two, is making the jump to Switch on 4th November. This was one of the many announcements that was heavily rumoured by multiple people last week, but it's fantastic to see this acclaimed title finally hop over to the hybrid console.
This platforming adventure game sees a married couple, who are on the brink of divorce, get turned into dolls by their daughter. Rose then play-acts with the two dolls in an attempt to fix her parent's relationship. The game is a co-op experience designed to be played split-screen with a partner — or friend, or whoever you want (or online, even!). The game's multiple levels are inspired by different genres and each one requires you to co-operate with your partner in order to progress.
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Critically-Acclaimed Co-Op Game 'It Takes Two' Confirmed For Switch

articles.description:
Breath of the Wild's sequel gets a release date.
Quite possibly the most anticipated title on Switch's list of upcoming games, The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom (known as The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild 2 up until this point) has now been confirmed to be launching on 12th May 2023. Pre-order options are already available for those eager to secure a copy, so let's get straight to it.
Below, you'll find some of the best pre-order options available at this early stage (note that some listings are still showing as 'Breath of the Wild 2, but are for the correct product) as well as some recommendations for other great Zelda titles you can play on Switch ahead of its release.
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Guide: Where To Pre-Order The Legend Of Zelda: Tears Of The Kingdom On Switch

articles.description:
Out in 2023.
Spike Chunsoft has revealed Master Detective Archives: Rain Code, a noir-adventure game set to release on the Switch in Spring 2023.
From the creators of the Danganronpa series, the game certainly displays a similar visual style to the iconic RPG series, with gameplay that actually reminds us of Atlus' Persona franchise.
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: The Minds Behind Danganronpa Reveal 'Master Detective Archives: Rain Code'

articles.description:
Brings a tear to the eye.
The box art for the newly-named Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom has been revealed along with several versions of the key art that will be used for the upcoming game — and we have to say it's a real looker!
Apparently, a picture paints a thousand words, so we'll pipe down and just get to it, shall we? Behold the box art for BOTW2 TOTK:
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Here's A Look At The Stunning Box Art For Zelda: Tears Of The Kingdom

articles.description:
Our reunion...
Square Enix had an incredibly healthy showing during today's Nintendo Direct, and one of its biggest announcements was an official release date for Crisis Core: Final Fantasy VII Reunion. The remake of the PSP game is launching on Switch (and other consoles) on 13th December with beautiful visuals and rearranged music.
The developer released a separate trailer for the game after the Direct, which shows highlights from the game's story. Crisis Core is a prequel to the original PlayStation smash RPG Final Fantasy VII and shows Zack Fair's story as a Soldier at Shinra.
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Crisis Core: Final Fantasy VII Reunion Refreshes PSP Favourite This December

articles.description:
Co-op farming sim out Q2 2023.
Publisher Phoenix Labs has announced Fae Farm, a brand new farming sim that "invites players to escape with friends into an enchanted world filled with wonder".
Due to launch in Q2 2023, Fae Farm is being built with co-op play in mind and lets you drop in and out of sessions both online and via local multiplayer. You'll be able to build farms with your friends, take on quests together, and work to restore harmony to the land of Azoria.
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Fae Farm Promises The Depth Of Stardew Valley And The Charm Of Fantasy Life

articles.description:
Give us more Kirby!
Originally released on Wii back in 2011, Kirby's sword swinging adventure is coming to the Switch in Kirby's Return to Dream Land Deluxe on February 24th, 2023.
The game is set to bring over all of the powered-up fun from the original and combine it with some new features such as the Mecha Copy Ability which seems to turn Kirby into something of a blaster-wielding transformer?
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Kirby's Return To Dream Land Deluxe Flies To Switch Next February

articles.description:
The music... Oh, the music.
Xseed Games has announced that it will be releasing Story of Seasons: A Wonderful Life for the Nintendo Switch, launching in Summer 2023.
The game is a full remake of Harvest Moon: A Wonderful Life, which originally launched on the GameCube back in 2003. It sure looks and sounds familiar too, with the main theme bringing back all those wonderful memories, along with and a few tears, too...
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Story Of Seasons: A Wonderful Life Remakes A Farming Classic

articles.description:
Yes, including THAT one.
Nintendo has announced that a new batch of Nintendo 64 games will be coming to the Expansion Pack tier of its Nintendo Switch Online subscription service.
As detailed in the latest Nintendo Direct for September 2022, the following eight titles — as well as the long-rumoured return of GoldenEye 007 — were announced as coming sometime this year or next:
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: More N64 Games Are Coming To The Nintendo Switch Online Expansion Pack

articles.description:
Coming this Holiday.
Nintendo Switch Sports has been a constant for many during the past few months, and with five sports already included in the game, fans have been waiting eagerly for an update that's been due on the fairways for a little while.
During today's Nintendo Direct, we now know that golf — which will be added as a free update — will be landing a little later than expected. Originally set to tee off this Fall, Nintendo revealed that it will be loading up the clubs for the courses just in time for the Holiday season instead. But we do know what to expect when we can don our golfing gear later in the year.
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Nintendo Switch Sports Golf Will Tee Off A Bit Later Than Expected

articles.description:
Time to pick a side.
The Nintendo Direct Showcase has just confirmed that the next Splatoon 3 Splatfest is coming 23rd September 5pm PT/1am BST - 25th September 5pm PT/1am BST.
The theme for this one is slightly more unusual than those we have seen before, with you having to choose what you would bring to a deserted island: Gear, Grub or Fun?
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Splatoon 3's Next Splatfest Is On The Way

articles.description:
The catch? They're 'Cloud Versions'.
During today's Nintendo Direct Showcase, Capcom revealed that several Resident Evil games will be coming to the Switch. These include Resident Evil: Village, Resident Evil: Biohazard (7), Resident Evil 2, and Resident Evil 3.
The catch, of course, is that all games will be available as Cloud Versions, which isn't ideal, but we'll take what we can get.
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Several Major Resident Evil Games Are Coming To Switch

articles.description:
Tis the season.
It feels like Wave 2 for Mario Kart 8 Deluxe's DLC pass only just launched, but we're already looking ahead to Wave 3. Nintendo confirmed during its September Direct that eight more courses will be arriving at the start line this Holiday season. That makes it the perfect family game to fall out over before the celebrations, then!
The brief trailer showed us two of the upcoming eight tracks that we'll be burning rubber on in the near future — Merry Mountain from Mario Kart Tour and Peach Gardens from Mario Kart DS! Merry Mountain is the perfect Christmas course, which will put a smile on our face, while Peach Gardens is a returning favourite.
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Mario Kart 8 Deluxe Booster Course Pass Wave 3 Will Launch This Holiday

articles.description:
Not lost in a fire, then.
In an announcement that we genuinely hadn't predicted, Shigeru Miyamoto just made an appearance at the Nintendo Direct Showcase to reveal that Pikmin 4 is on its way, finally! Check out the teaser trailer above.
While there was little in terms of gameplay or release information, Miyamoto stated that the game is going to employ a new Pikmin deployment mechanic in which you will be able to play in a mode much closer to the ground.
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Pikmin 4 Is Set For A 2023 Release, Following Years Of Speculation

articles.description:
New trailer for the game formerly known as BOTW2.
Nintendo has finally announced the real title for the game formerly known as The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild 2 — say hello to The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom, launching on 12th May 2023.
The new trailer (above) doesn't give much away in terms of new gameplay, focusing on some stone wall art in the opening section before following Link as he leaps into the sky and onto a stone bird-looking flying creature.
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: 'The Legend Of Zelda: Tears Of The Kingdom' Launches In May 2023

articles.description:
Meet Ino.
Have you spotted that silhouette in Xenoblade Chronicles 3's Expansion Pass? Well, now we know who that character is! Ino is a mechanical companion who you'll be able to recruit when Wave 2 launches on 13th October.
Ino will be a Defender hero with the class "Noponic Champion", but she'll also have what looks like her own skill tree. Challenge battles and, most importantly, swimsuit costumes, will also be making their way to the game.
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Xenoblade Chronicles 3 DLC Introduces New Hero, Swimsuits, Wave 2 Out October

articles.description:
Melodies of life.
It's finally happened! During today's Nintendo Direct, we found out that we're finally getting a brand new Theatrythm game on the Switch. Consoles haven't seen a new rhythm-based Final Fantasy game since the 3DS' Curtain Call, but now, Theatrhythm Final Bar Line will be changing that when it launches on 16th February 2023.
This new game in the cutesy music game will be bringing 385 songs to the base game, and DLC and a Season Pass will be available to buy after the game's launch.
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: A New Theatrythm Final Fantasy Makes A Symphony On Switch Next February

sources.title: Rock Paper Shotgun Latest Articles Feed

articles.author: Alice O'Connor
articles.description:
I only just realised, while mentioning the dev's next game, that we never posted about excellent indie horror game Mothered. Not to be confused with the unrelated Remothered games, it's the tale of a young girl returning home after surgery to find everything is weird and her mother is some sort of eerie mannequin. It might be my favourite horror game of 2021? Now's a good time to raise Mothered because: 1) it finally has a demo for newcomers; 2) for veterans, that demo actually hides a secret expansion continuing the game's story.
Read more
articles.title: Excellent indie horror game Mothered has a small sequel hiding in its demo

articles.author: CJ Wheeler
articles.description:
Square Enix have confirmed that their hitherto Switch-exclusive turn-based tactics RPG Triangle Strategy will be coming to PC on October 13th. The announcement was buried amongst a whole bundle of other JRPG information from today’s Nintendo Direct broadcast. You’ll have to make do with the Switch trailer below for now, I’m afraid, because Squeenix haven’t released a PC one yet.

 
Read more
articles.title: Tactics RPG Triangle Strategy advances from Switch to PC in October

articles.author: CJ Wheeler
articles.description:
Square Enix’s original HD-2D game Octopath Traveler is getting a sequel, releasing on February 24th 2023. The surprise announcement during today’s Nintendo Direct showed a little bit of what to expect from the game, which is also coming to PC on the very same day. Check out the first trailer below.

 
Read more
articles.title: Octopath Traveler 2 coming to PC on February 24th 2023

articles.author: CJ Wheeler
articles.description:
Anime show Cyberpunk: Edgerunners is streaming on Netflix from today, more than two years after the big tudum and Cyberpunk 2077 developers CD Projekt announced they were working together. The show may have hit whatever the 21st century equivalent of airwaves is and become a tangible piece of media to consume now, but CD Projekt have confirmed in an earnings call that they’re still “fully committed” to continuing with the Cyberpunk IP. I can’t believe I just typed the term IP.

 
Read more
articles.title: Cyberpunk: Edgerunners finally slides its futuristic motorbike onto Netflix today

articles.author: CJ Wheeler
articles.description:
Troubled live-service action RPG Babylon’s Fall will close its doors on February 28th 2023, Square Enix and developers Platinum Games have revealed today. The game had struggled to make an impact since its launch on March 3rd earlier this year, with concurrent player counts dropping to zero at times. It hadn't looked good from the early days when, as we pointed out, Platinum Games were tweeting statements that Babylon’s Fall’s wasn’t "in danger" just two weeks following its launch.

 
Read more
articles.title: Babylon’s Fall is shutting down in February 2023, just before its first birthday

articles.author: CJ Wheeler
articles.description:
343 Industries founder and studio head Bonnie Ross has announced that she’s leaving the Halo: Infinite studio. Ross said her departure was due to a “family medical issue” in a statement shared on her Twitter account. She’d been at the company since it was established in 2007.

 
Read more
articles.title: Halo boss Bonnie Ross is leaving 343 Industries

articles.author: CJ Wheeler
articles.description:
The next EA Original has been announced, and it’s coming from Koei Tecmo and Omega Force, developers of the Dynasty Warriors series. Set in Japan during its feudal period but with a fantasy twist, EA and Koei Tecmo describe the as-yet-untitled project as “the next great hunting game”. Dispel those mental images of theHunter: Call Of The Wild and Big Buck Hunter though, because it sounds like this is more in the vein of hack-and-slash monster hunting shenanigans.

 
Read more
articles.title: The next EA Original is a fantasy hunting game set in feudal Japan from Koei Tecmo

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
The Steam Deck is finally releasing across Asia this month, and ahead of its appearance at the Tokyo Game Show (complete with unnervingly large replica of the handheld), Valve held their own launch event with a display of several prototype designs. Unlike the mere low-res images of abandoned Steam Deck designs we’ve already seen, however, these were mostly functional PC gaming machines. That’s according to Valve engineer Pierre-Loup Griffais, who shared a video of an early, more rounded-looking Deck booting to SteamOS and loading up Half-Life 2.

 
Read more
articles.title: Valve show off working Steam Deck prototypes for the first time

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Correctly striking a succession of notes in a rhythm game gives me a huge high, but I'm more familiar with feeling the corresponding low. A succession of missed notes whizzing past sounds like an ode to my failure, and in mashups that mix demanding rhythms with another genre - like Crypt Of The Necrodancer, say - these reminders of my musical inadequacy often drown out even the simplest pleasures. 

Often but not always. Metal: Hellsinger's mix of rhythm game and Doom 2016-style shooter kept me tapping my foot as I battled through hell - even as I failed regularly, and even as someone who doesn't care for metal music.

 
Read more
articles.title: Metal: Hellsinger review: a rhythm shooter that can be anybody's tempo

articles.author: CJ Wheeler
articles.description:
Fantasy action RPG Forspoken has been delayed more times than most games, although it’s finally pencilled in for a January release date. We’re still quite a way off from then, but Sony have released a smattering more gameplay footage today, detailing the moves you'll be pulling as heroine Frey "I'm seeing freaking dragons" Holland. Alas, said footage has been crushed down to only a handful of GIFs over on the PlayStation Blog, but our friends at Eurogamer have a bigger, chunkier hands on preview that tells us more about why it won't be mega cringe. Alas, we weren't privy to this Forspoken demo, so have a watch with us below.

 
Read more
articles.title: Forspoken looks like a faster, zippier FF15 in fiery new gameplay footage

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
I did a lot of talking at Gamescom, whether that be to developers or muttering to myself deliriously as I typed stuff up in the evening. Talking to devs especially is a wonderful thing, especially when you're playing their game and it resonates with you. But getting hands-on with an early portion of American Arcadia rendered me virtually silent, to the point where I had to apologise to the devs for being so quiet.
And I wasn't being rude; far from it! I was just so engrossed in the game's mixture of side-scrolling platforming and first-person puzzling. Keep this under surveillance, because I think it's going to be a real hit when it lands.
Read more
articles.title: American Arcadia is a genre-flipping cinematic feast from the Call Of The Sea devs

articles.author: CJ Wheeler
articles.description:
Focus Entertainment have paid an undisclosed amount to acquire historical shooter devs WW1 Game Series, known for Verdun, Tannenberg and the upcoming Isonzo, from M2H. Set on the Italian Front, Isonzo actually happens to be out tomorrow too. Have a peek at the game, replete with many moustaches, in the trailer below.

 
Read more
articles.title: WW1 Verdun and Tannenberg devs have been bought by Focus Entertainment

articles.author: Alice Bell
articles.description:
Gloomwood is, so far, a very good game, but it is also not much of a game - in the literal sense that it has launched into early access incomplete. There's currently just enough of it to play that it makes you feel both bereft and quite annoyed when it suddenly clangs its great iron doors shut in front of you. "Let me in!!" you scream, as you hammer on the silent portal. "I really like Thief! I get you! I want to throw more decapitated heads as lures!"
If you are one of those people who bases their gaming personality on liking the original Thief series, Gloomwood will have been on your radar for a while. It's a grimy, steampunk-ish stealth immersive sim with a deliberate low-poly vibe, and it picks up the abandoned Thief football to absolutely run with it. But, though the current EA build is but short, it feels like Gloomwood is aiming to punt that ball into outer space. There's so much more room to be playful and experiment than I expected, and it's so much fun that if you'd never played a stealth sim in your life I'd recommend Gloomwood. Except I wouldn't, because it feels like I'd be doing you a disservice to recommend it now, when the fun will be so quickly snatched away.
Read more
articles.title: Gloomwood's grimy stealth playground deserves better than the agony of early access

articles.author: Katharine Castle
articles.description:
It's a very odd feeling, building a catapult all on your lonesome while watching fiery death rain down on your enemy's castle in the valley below. I suspect it's probably a similar experience to watching the carnage of Chivalry II play out from the safety of a nearby bench. The newly announced Warlander from Nier Replicant devs Toylogic certainly has the medieval setting in common with Torn Banner Studio's first-person hack and slash, but this free-to-play multiplayer warfare game is an altogether different beast. You control your warriors in third-person, for starters, and its more cartoonish visuals allow for, well, daft cataclysmic events like a flaming meteor shower to hone in on a player's position without appearing completely over the top. As it prepares to enter its first open beta later today, September 12th, I went hands on with a brief demo build to see what it was all about. 
Read more
articles.title: Warlander is third-person Chivalry with apocalyptic meteor showers

articles.author: Katharine Castle
articles.description:
"Oh, come on!" is a phrase you hear a lot in Sunday Gold. It's often uttered by your knuckle-dusting healer Sally, and is invariably followed up by, "You havin' a laugh, mate?" and "Facking hell!" - partly because Sally is from Laaaandan and is thus obligated to speak lik' tha', innit (because how else would you know this is a game set in Laaaandan), but also because the thugs, security guards and cybernetic dogs she's often fighting in this seedy tale of corporate dystopia are some of the most frustrating enemies known to video games. The type who are seemingly resistant to every single weapon type in your arsenal, or who invariably have big, scripted healing sequences just when you're about to nail 'em. 
It's a phrase I often found myself echoing while playing Sunday Gold for review, too, both during its tedious, war of attrition-style turn-based battles, and while trying to figure out some of its more obtuse puzzles. BKOM Studios have tried to fuse one too many things together in Sunday Gold, and the result is a messy, somewhat artificial blend of Deathloop's style, Invisible Inc's tension and a more action-led focus on the cerebral role-playing of Disco Elysium. There's still much to admire in its stylish visuals and atmospheric music, but I also haven't been this cross playing a video game since Felix The Reaper, and that's saying something. 
Read more
articles.title: Sunday Gold review: tactical point and click puzzling that fails to mesh

articles.author: CJ Wheeler
articles.description:
Ubisoft’s subscription service doesn’t have the user-base of something like Microsoft’s Game Pass. Now, it seems, the French publishers are hoping that plonking in some indie games among its multitudes of Assassin’s Creeds and Tom Clancy shooters will attract a more varied clientele. They’re also running a free trial period for Ubisoft+ until October 10th, including for lapsed subscribers, so that’s something.

 
Read more
articles.title: Ubisoft start adding indie games to their Ubisoft+ subscription service

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
Despite Black Friday 2022’s roots as a Christmas shopping event, apparently people want to start keeping an eye on it in September? It’s 23°c outside and folks are already thinking about PC gaming deals they might want in the damp, dark, dying days of November. Hey, I’m not knocking it, and I’ll even put together this guide that early Black Friday birds might find useful. I just don’t even think of what I want for dinner later.

 
Read more
articles.title: Black Friday 2022: dates, tips, and PC gaming deals to expect

articles.author: CJ Wheeler
articles.description:
Square Enix are taking more steps to implement the controversial blockchain technology in their games. Squeenix have teamed with blockchain company Oasys, who describe themselves as “environmentally-friendly”. This is because of their less energy-intensive “proof-of-stake” mechanism compared to “proof-of-work” methods such as those used in Bitcoin mining. Oasys's plans fits with Squeenix’s intention to develop tokenised economies built on blockchain in their future games.

 
Read more
articles.title: Square Enix sink into partnership with "environmentally-friendly" blockchain firm Oasys

articles.author: Alice O'Connor
articles.description:
Every weekend, indie devs show off current work on Twitter's #screenshotsaturday tag. And every Monday, I bring you a selection of these snaps and clips. This weekend, my eye has been caught my beings growing strange and wonderful bodyparts for cool movement. Also, there's a photo of a cat.
Read more
articles.title: Screenshot Saturday Mondays: freaky bodies and a lovely cat

articles.author: CJ Wheeler
articles.description:
Assassin’s Creed: Mirage's age rating is leading to some speculation on forum ResetEra that it could feature gambling for real-world money, following the game's reveal during the Ubisoft Forward event. An ESRB 18+ rating that lists "real gambling" appears to be in effect for the upcoming back-to-basics Assassin’s Creed set in 9th century Baghdad. If you missed the first look at Mirage over the weekend then you can watch the cinematic trailer below.

 
Read more
articles.title: Assassin’s Creed: Mirage’s 18+ rating leads to online speculation that it’ll include real-money gambling

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Sony have been regularly releasing games on PC for a while now, with an often quick turnaround between 'announcement' and 'it's out now'. The exception is the Uncharted: Legacy Of Thieves Collection, which was confirmed for PC back in September 2021 but which still hasn't arrived.

It seems like that will change soon. A recent, hastily-removed update to the collection's Epic Games Store page declared that it would release on October 19th.

 
Read more
articles.title: Uncharted: Legacy Of Thieves Collection will arrive on PC in October, leak suggests

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Valve have opened repair centres for the Steam Deck. These are where you'll send your handheld PC if it develops a problem, either so Valve can fix it free-of-charge if it's still under warranty, or so they can diagnose the problem and quote you a repair price if it's not. "If your dog gnaws on your thumbstick and breaks it, this is not covered by warranty," say Valve.

 
Read more
articles.title: Steam Deck repair centers are open now

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Before announcing a bazillion Assassin's Creed games during tonight's Ubisoft Forward stream, the publisher did first show a handful of other games. Among them was a first look at The Division: Heartland, a free-to-play spin-off from the Clancyverse shooter, which was described as an "action survival shooter." You can watch it below.

 
Read more
articles.title: The Division: Heartland's first trailer gives little away about the free-to-player shooter

articles.author: Alice Bell
articles.description:
As was leaked, and then hurriedly confirmed by Ubisoft about a week ago, the next Assassin's Creed game to come out will be Mirage, in 2023. It's not going to be quite the massive open world adventure 'em up that the last few entries have been (don't worry; one of those is on the way as well), but a more classic AssCreed experience to mark the series' 15th anniversary. This milestone has made me realise that the Creedsperience has taken up almost half of my current lifespan. Or, to put it another way, I fear that playing Assassin's Creed Mirage may induce a pathetic but very real existential crisis in me.
Read more
articles.title: Assassin's Creed Mirage is going back to the series' roots in 2023 for the 15th anniversary

articles.author: Alice Bell
articles.description:
A not-insignificant part of the Ubisoft Forward livestream tonight was dedicated to Assassin's Creed. To celebrate the doughty action-adventure's 15th anniversary, senior community developer Alice Terrett was joined by a, to his credit, very excited Danny "it's the Daddy" Wallace, to lay out an almost MCU-like timeline of every Assassin's Creed thing happening for the next good while. It includes new DLC for Valhalla, and a mysterious horror-ish tease. But top of the list, after next year's more trad and compact Assassin's Creed Mirage, is Assassin's Creed: Codename Red, the next big flagship open-world RPG for the series. And it's set in feudal Japan.
Read more
articles.title: Assassin's Creed is finally heading to feudal Japan, plus one with Blair Witch vibes

articles.author: Alice Bell
articles.description:
About a year ago we learned about the existence of something called Assassin's Creed Infinity (or, more precisely, Project Infinity, but we're all just calling it Infinity). The suggestion that Assassin's Creed might become a live service online game akin to Fortnite was quite upsetting to me. Thankfully, VP executive producer on Assassin's Creed Marc-Alexis Côté (aka MAC) appeared on tonight's Ubisoft Forward livestream to explain more about Infinity, and I am slightly less alarmed but no less confused. Rather than a game, MAC says that Infinity is "going to be the single entry point for our fans into the Assassin's Creed franchise in the future".
Read more
articles.title: Assassin's Creed Infinity still exists, is still a confusing Assassin's Creed live service, maybe?

articles.author: Will Judd
articles.description:
The Crucial P5 Plus is one of the most affordable 'second-gen' PCIe 4.0 SSDs, offering sequential read speeds up to a storming 6600MB/s while costing less than alternatives like the Samsung 980 Pro and WD Black SN850. As you may have guessed from the title of this post, it's also on sale at Amazon for a very reasonable price: £59 gets you a 500GB model compared to a UK RRP of £101. 
Read more
articles.title: The blazing-fast PCIe 4.0 Crucial P5 Plus SSD is down to £59 for a 500GB model

articles.author: Will Judd
articles.description:
360mm AiOs seem to be becoming more of a necessity these days, with ever-hotted high-end processors from the likes of AMD and particularly Intel. Thankfully, they're also becoming increasingly inexpensive, with this post in particular spotlighting a deal on the EVGA CLC 360. This cooler normally costs £109, but today you can pick it up for £82 after a 25% discount.
Read more
articles.title: Pick up an EVGA 360mm AiO for £82 after a 25% discount on Amazon

articles.author: Alice O'Connor
articles.description:
Summer is ebbing away, and I hate how it goes. I already miss long evenings, with sunset now before 8pm but sunrise still pointlessly at like 6:30? No thanks. I don't miss those 5am sunrises either. So we can surely all agree that the sensible course of action would be to lock sunrise to 7:30am and rotate the whole clock around that. Anyway! What are you playing this weekend? Here's what we're clicking on.
Read more
articles.title: What are we all playing this weekend?

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Marvel Snap, the card game from some former HearthStone devs featuring a multiverse of Marvel superheroes, now has a release date. It was announced during this evening's Disney & Marvel games showcase that it would launch on October 18th.

 
Read more
articles.title: Marvel Snap will play its multiverse of superhero cards this October

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
As previously announced, Amy Hennig's game for Marvel was shown during this evening's Disney games showcase. As was leaked, it's about Captain America and Black Panther working to fight against Hydra during World War 2. What I didn't expect at all was that the game still wouldn't have a name, although there are a few other details to glean from the most teasery teaser trailer.

 
Read more
articles.title: Amy Hennig's untitled Marvel game has its first teaser trailer

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
For my money, if you want a story about a society set inside a computer, look to ReBoot. But I suppose Tron might satisfy, too. A new visual novel set in the neon universe called Tron: Identity was announced during this evening's Disney & Marvel games showcase, and it's being developed by Bithell Games. There's a very brief teaser trailer below.

 
Read more
articles.title: Tron: Identity is a new visual novel from Bithell Games

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
After several delays, Marvel's Midnight Suns has a new release date. The new strategy game from XCOM developers Firaxis will launch on December 2nd, as announced during this evening's Disney/Marvel games showcase.

 
Read more
articles.title: Marvel's Midnight Suns' new release date is this December

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Foxhole hits 1.0 later this month after years in Steam Early Access, and the update will bring the most exciting possible addition to the massively multiplayer war game: trains. Also, player-built factories, and several other features which should make players focused on the logistics of warfare very happy. There's a new trailer below ahead of its release on September 28th.

 
Read more
articles.title: Foxhole is adding player-built trains and factories as it hits 1.0 this month

articles.author: Sin Vega
articles.description:
You start out aiming to restore a princess to a throne, which naturally tempted me on her every turn to lunge onto the nearest spear for a punchline, but I will forgive Tyrant's Blessing for circumstances beyond its control.
Like everything, it's also a roguelike, but it's transparent and fair enough that I can reluctantly forgive that too, not least because I've found myself enjoying this one the more it went on. It's a lighter, cheerier sibling of Into The Breach that's half tactical fighter, half puzzler, and its default difficulty setting is close to perfect if you're looking for something less intense that will still catch you out now and then.
Read more
articles.title: Tyrant's Blessing's low pressure tactical puzzles let it punch above its weight

articles.author: Alice O'Connor
articles.description:
Our undercover man has been compromised and you've mere hours to extract him from a nightclub using every tool in your agent's toolbox: deception, wisecracks, dancing, drinking puddle water, and baking pizza. That's Betrayal At Club Low, the latest game from Cosmo D, set in the same strange city as Off-Peak, The Norwood Suite, and Tales From Off-Peak City. This time, it's an honest-to-goodness RPG, full of skill checks, strange solutions, multiple endings, and so very many dice. And it's great. And it has a demo.
Read more
articles.title: Betrayal At Club Low review: a delicious snack-sized espionage RPG set in a nightclub

articles.author: CJ Wheeler
articles.description:
Cast your mind back to a few months ago, when the sun was shinier and the leaves were greener. Remember all the furore over Nier: Automata’s supposed secret church? Well, now you too can play the greatest trick the Internet ever pulled on people who enjoy Yoko Taro games a bit too much. SadFutago’s The Nier: Automata Church mod is finally ready to download from NexusMods.

 
Read more
articles.title: Nier: Automata’s secret church is finally enshrined on NexusMods

articles.author: Katharine Castle
articles.description:
Despite lamenting the other week that the rest of 2022's gaming calendar was looking a bit weak sauce after endless delay announcements, September is shaping up to be an absolutely monster month for indie releases right now. As Alice Bee noted earlier in the week, there are just too many cool, interesting games coming out for us to review effectively on the site at the moment (although rest assured, we will do our darnedest to cover as many of them as we can).
Part of the challenge is working out what's worth reviewing, and what we think is worth highlighting for you, our readers. The other part, though, is often entirely selfish on our part, just playing and writing about cool games we like. In fact, the decision to review many of the games we covered this week - Railbound, Jack Move and Roadwarden - were all down to having played and liked some form of demo, making events like the Steam Next Fest an increasingly invaluable tool in helping us cut through the noise when we inevitably enter mega months like September. 
Read more
articles.title: The power of a Steam Next Fest demo

articles.author: CJ Wheeler
articles.description:
Overwatch 2 won’t be locking new heroes behind a paid battle pass, it’s emerged. Blizzard VP Jon Spector confirmed that heroes will be available through a free track for the battle pass. Spector’s comments were an attempt to put an end to speculation over what he described as “incomplete info” circulating online about Overwatch 2’s battle pass.

 
Read more
articles.title: Overwatch 2’s battle pass has a free track and won’t lock heroes behind a paywall

articles.author: CJ Wheeler
articles.description:
Long-running sci-fi MMO Star Trek: Online’s Ascension update transports us to the Mirror Universe once again on September 13th, and it’s a doozy. Devs Cryptic Studios have only gone and revealed The Next Generation’s wunderkind Wesley “Shut up” Crusher as the storyline’s big bad. Cower from the arrival of Mirror Wesley while watching the trailer below. 

 
Read more
articles.title: The Next Generation's Wesley Crusher becomes Star Trek: Online’s Terran Emperor next week

articles.author: CJ Wheeler
articles.description:
Gremlins’ Gizmo has finally landed in MultiVersus, just a few days later than originally advertised. The Warner Bros. licensed brawler’s also been given an update that’s meant to improve hitboxes and hurtboxes, and rebalances characters. Watch the introductory trailer for Gizmo below. He’s a mogwai, you know, not a gremlin. I was misinformed!

 
Read more
articles.title: Gremlins cutie Gizmo arrives in MultiVersus, and he’s just in time for the latest update

articles.author: CJ Wheeler
articles.description:
Some details from Skydance New Media’s in-development Marvel game appear to have leaked, ahead of the game’s debut at Disney D23's games showcase later today. The game is alleged to star national superheroes Captain America and Wakanda’s Black Panther, and take place during World War 2. Skydance’s project is being headed up by former Uncharted director Amy Hennig, helmer of such unfortunately cancelled projects as Visceral's Star Wars action-adventure.

 
Read more
articles.title: Details from Amy Hennig’s Marvel game emerge ahead of today's Disney & Marvel Games Showcase

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
In an announcement today, general manager of the Battlefield series Byron Beede announced that Ridgeline Games, the new EA studio led by Halo co-creator Marcus Lehto, is developing the next singleplayer campaign in the series.

Beede also wrote that they are "all-in on Battlefield", with DICE continuing to work on Battlefield multiplayer and a third studio, Ripple Effect, "creating an entirely new Battlefield experience."

 
Read more
articles.title: Battlefield's next campaign being developed by Halo co-creator's new studio

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
The Steam store has been updated to introduce revised hub pages for tags, genres, theme and category pages. The changes include clearer personal recommendations, easier access to subcategories, and further options for searching and filtering. The changes come after months of testing as one of Valve's Steam Labs experiments.

 
Read more
articles.title: Steam has launched new hub pages to make browsing genres and tags easier

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
I somehow missed that Wolfenstein: Enemy Territory came to Steam back in April, 19 years after it was first released. Now Bethesda have announced that they're launching new dedicated servers for the free World War 2 shooter, which will all run the six original maps with no mods.

 
Read more
articles.title: Wolfenstein: Enemy Territory now has new official dedicated servers

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Eidos Montreal, the studio behind recent Thief and Deus Ex games, say they are "now the owner of the games [we] developed, like the Deus Ex and Thief games." Likewise, Crystal Dynamics say they have taken "control" of its Tomb Raider and Legacy Of Kain games from their previous owner, Square Enix.

Which sounds like a big deal, but really both studios are just reporting a change to their terms of service and privacy notices since they were bought by Embracer Group last month.

 
Read more
articles.title: Eidos Montreal is "now the owner" of Deus Ex and Thief games, but don't get too excited

articles.author: Sin Vega
articles.description:
Do you ever feel like you're sitting down with a game like a worried parent, saying "I just don't know what to do with you?" Because that's how I feel about Phoenix Point after the last few months of playing it on and off. I’ve definitely enjoyed it more than on its release in 2019, and its DLC adds more to think about and manage during what were once long lull periods. There's a lot to like about its final form. There's also a lot to... I don't quite want to say hate, but I'm also not quite sure why. It's one of the most evenly mixed bags I've ever rummaged around in. 
Read more
articles.title: The Rally Point: Phoenix Point's final form still frustrates as much as it innovates

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
FSR 2.0 – AMD’s graphics card-powered upscaling tech for boosting games performance – already has a newer, prettier version. AMD have announced FSR 2.1, which is available to developers immediately, and has made its playable debut via a Farming Simulator 22 update – just a couple of days after FSR 2.0 got its latest big-name backing from Red Dead Redemption 2.

 
Read more
articles.title: AMD launch FSR 2.1 for sharper GPU upscaling

articles.author: CJ Wheeler
articles.description:
Space-based alternate reality EVE: Online is getting another expansion focusing on factional warfare this November, devs CCP Games have announced. Uprising promises to move the ongoing story of EVE forwards, along with improvements such as new ships, balance changes to old ships, logos on your ships, and a whole bunch of other stuff to do with ships. 

 
Read more
articles.title: EVE: Online’s Uprising expansion changes up factional warfare in November

articles.author: CJ Wheeler
articles.description:
Speedrun charity fest organisers Games Done Quick have revealed the dates for winter’s Awesome Games Done Quick event, and noted that it’ll once again be held online rather than in-person. They’ll be bringing the speedruns from January 8th to 15th this time around. AGDQ 2023 had originally been planned to take place in Florida, but that’s scrapped due to the state’s attitudes towards COVID-19 and LGBTQ+ people.

 
Read more
articles.title: Awesome Games Done Quick 2023 is staying digital because Florida

articles.author: Alice Bell
articles.description:
We enter the new pod-century on the Electronic Wireless Show podcast a man down, as Matthew won't be here for a few weeks. Not to worry, though, as myself and Nate are ever ready to hold down the fort. This week we're talking about our favourite cinematics in video games, a fitting subject because last weekend I saw the greatest piece of cinema yet conceived by man: Michael Flatley's Blackbird.
I do spend quite a lot of time explaining Blackbird to Nate, but after that we do talk about some cutscenes and cinematics in games (as well as litigating the difference between the two, and Nate tries to remember the first time he saw a cutscene in a game that was in-engine rather than being pre-rendered). And today the Cavern Of Lies is a Cavern Of Justice, after we received a troubling missive from one [squints] Brond Coatwear?
Read more
articles.title: The Electronic Wireless Show podcast episode 201: the best cinematics in games

articles.author: Alice Bell
articles.description:
I saw a panel of thriller authors a couple of months back and one of them made reference to "the fat chapter", and the others all went "Ohhhh, yes, the fat chapter!". Thriller writers deal in short, snappy chapters, and the fat chapter is the one that ends up getting a load of events or exposition shoved into it, somewhere in the second half, because they wouldn't fit anywhere else. Every year in games there's a fat month, where loads of games come out and loads of them look really good and there is never enough time godammit.
This year that month is September. There are so many games out this month that look so much my jam that I want to spread 'em on my morning toast, but September is also the month that a lot of RPS staff have holiday booked - including me, for two weeks, which means that if these games do get reviewed it probably won't be by me. But know that I have my beady little eyes on 'em.
Read more
articles.title: 5 weird games out in September that I might not have time to review but really want to

articles.author: CJ Wheeler
articles.description:
Football Manager 2023 starts its career on November 8th, publishers Sega have announced today, and it’s also coming to Game Pass on launch day alongside its regular PC release. Put on your warmest big coat and take a glance at the stats-heavy trailer below.

 
Read more
articles.title: Football Manager 2023 scores a PC and Game Pass release date of November 8th

articles.author: Hayden Hefford
articles.description:
Temtem’s inspiration has always been clear. We didn’t beat around the bush when it entered early access back in 2020 - Cian Maher called it the best Pokemon game in years - and I won’t beat around the bush now. It’s still the best Pokemon game in years. It borrows so much from Nintendo's behemoth, but it also takes some much-needed lessons that Game Freak fails to recognise, taking the formula to its highest evolution yet.
Read more
articles.title: Temtem review: a Pokemon-like that listens to what fans want

articles.author: CJ Wheeler
articles.description:
Monster-taming MMO Temtem just launched out of early access on PC earlier this week, but developers Crema have taken to Discord to defend the game’s paid battle pass. Some players have been getting themselves very worked up over the inclusion of a paid pass in a full-priced game. Yet there’s been a plan to include a battle pass in Temtem for years. Check out the game’s launch trailer below while you wrap your head around it all.

 
Read more
articles.title: Temtem devs address its premium battle pass controversy

articles.author: Katharine Castle
articles.description:
It cannot be a coincidence that 1997 is a pivotal year in the world of Jack Move. In the game, it's the year everything went dark in this turn-based Japanese-style RPG, with a solar storm biffing the world's electronics. It threw the world into chaos, giving rise to the megacorps that now control the dystopian cyberpunk society where our heroine Noa is trying to make a living. In the real world, of course, 1997 was the year Final Fantasy VII came out, the seminal JRPG that Jack Move owes a great deal to (right down to its menu plink plink sound). Developers So Romantic have said outright that it's been one of the main inspirations for Jack Move, and its shady corporate powers and grungy urban landscape certainly feel of a piece with ShinRa's grip on the city of Midgar. 
But the bigwigs at MonoMind aren't out to poison the world and suck the life from it in Jack Move. Instead, they're more concerned with using their newfound technological powers to find eternal life – a classic 'upload your mind to the metaverse' kind of tale you'll probably recognise if you've read any of the cyberpunk 101 novels such as William Gibson's Neuromancer or Permutation City by Greg Egan. Jack Move's story doesn't tread any new ground in this respect, but Noa and her hacker pal Ryder are a fiery spirited pair that make this six-hour tale of espionage and rebellion against its cartoonish villain well worth dipping into. Yes, you read that correctly. A JRPG you can polish off in a single day of play. Bliss.
Read more
articles.title: Jack Move review: a bite-sized JRPG that blends Neuromancer with Final Fantasy VII

articles.author: Eden Assiene
articles.description:
Indie team Alblune, which consists of developers Lucie Lessuyer and Alexandre Stroukoff, have a release date for their cute new game The Spirit And The Mouse, a narrative-focussed adventure game with some platforming thrown in. In order to save the cosy town of Sainte-et-Claire, a charming mouse called Lila and a soft spirit called Lumion join forces to restore the town and its people. They'll be teaming up on Steam later this month on September 26th. Check out the trailer below.
Read more
articles.title: Bring a little light this month with charming adventure game The Spirit And The Mouse

articles.author: Jay Castello
articles.description:
I keep thinking about Roadwarden like a tourist city that I visited for not quite long enough. Sure, I saw the main sights and had a great time soaking in the ambiance, but I know that I missed so many hidden gems. I want to go back and explore, maybe this time with a local guide who knows its secrets.
At its most basic, Roadwarden is a text-based RPG. You play as the titular roadwarden, who sets out from the city to investigate an unmapped peninsula with little more than their horse for company. Your goal as set by the people who sent you is to investigate the region and report your findings in preparation for the expansion of trade guilds in the area. But you can also set your own goal, shaping your character’s approach from the start in a way that helps with roleplaying a particular kind of adventurer throughout. And once you get to that adventuring, dozens of sidequests open up covering everything from gathering fruit to curing the plague.
Read more
articles.title: Roadwarden review: a beautifully written visit to a mystery-filled peninsula

articles.author: CJ Wheeler
articles.description:
Vodeo Games, the first game development studio in North America to unionise, are shutting down. The team behind turn-based RPG Beast Breaker announced their closure on Twitter, after being unable to find financial backers for another project. Beast Breaker wasn’t a game I was familiar with but its little mouse protagonist looks charming, as you can see in the trailer below.

 
Read more
articles.title: Beast Breaker devs are closing due to lack of funding, along with their historic workers union

articles.author: Alice O'Connor
articles.description:
Every corner of Skyrim houses a locked chest, but where are all the keys? Only a handful actually have keys to open them. So do the chest's owners lockpick them every time they want an apple or knife? Are these chests merely decorative, their contents deemed inaccessible and long forgotten? A new mod for Skyrim Special Edition answers this playfully by adding a load of hidden keys to unlock these chests. Some of the keys look quite well hidden in this object hunt, so you'll need to poke around, rummage, and turn things over.
Read more
articles.title: Skyrim mod adds hidden keys to find for all those locked chests

articles.author: Katharine Castle
articles.description:
When we last saw Amicia and Hugo de Rune at the end of A Plague Tale: Innocence back in 2019, things were looking up for the orphaned rat wranglers. They'd escaped the clutches of the French Inquisition and the hordes of plague rats following in their wake, and the pair were hopeful about finding a cure for the cursed macula flowing through Hugo's veins.
Alas, when I pick up their journey in chapter six of Asobo's upcoming sequel, A Plague Tale: Requiem, Amicia is having a particularly terrible time of it.
